title: What is John’s present age, if after 10 years his age will be 5 times his age 5 years back? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let us assume his present age to be . Now, After ten years his age will be  Before five years his age was  Now,       His present age is 8.75 yrs or in other words 8 years 9 months. Hope this helps!!

Let John's present age = x After 10 years John's age = x + 10 So by the above statement: x + 10 = 5(x-5) x + 10 = 5x - 25 4x = 35 x = 8.75 Therefore John's present age is 8.75 years i.e. 8 years and 9 months. Hope it helps. #enes2six
